intro: Weigeltia multiflora, commonly known as the Florida beauty or swamp beauty, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soil. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Weigeltia multiflora is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ecological importance and adaptability to aquatic environments.
